summary: U.S. farmers face shortages of workers. The H-2A visa program allows these employers to temporarily fill jobs with foreign workers when U.S. workers aren't available. In recent years, the number of approved H-2A jobs and visas has increased by over 50%. Federal agencies are trying to keep up with application processing, but some information must be mailed rather than submitted online—adding time. Further, the Department...
title: H-2A Visa Program: Agencies Should Take Additional Steps to Improve Oversight and Enforcement
